Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide family (Brevinin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.14636071]Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus megaterium Bm11 (MIC=3 µM), Staphylococcus lentus (MIC=10 µM), Micrococcus luteus (MIC=8 µM);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli D21 (MIC=30 µM), Yersinia pseudotuberculosis YP III (MIC=5 µM), Pseudomonas syringae pv tabaci (MIC=16 µM);Fungi:Candida albicans ATCC 10231 (MIC=22 µM), Candida tropicalis (MIC=14 µM), C. guillermondii (MIC=1 µM), Phytophthora nicotianae spores (MIC=16 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.14636071] It has 20% hemolytic activity at 100 μM against human erythrocytes
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Mechanism of action: The mature peptide inserts into the hydrophobic core of the bacterial cell membrane and increases permeability without disrupting membrane integrity. Probably binds to the outer membrane surface before aggregating to form transmembrane pores. Has hemolytic activity.

Literature.Title: Ranacyclins, a new family of short cyclic antimicrobial peptides biological function, mode of action, and parameters involved in target specificity.
Literature.Author: Mangoni ML, Papo N, Mignogna G, Andreu D, Shai Y, Barra D, Simmaco M.

Literature.Title: Ranacyclins, a new family of short cyclic antimicrobial peptides: biological function, mode of action and parameters involved in target specificity.
Literature.Author: Shai Y.,Andreu D.,Mignogna G.,Papo N.,Mangoni M.L.
